description: From BitBLT, the name of a computer graphics operation which stands for bit-block transfer and is pronounced bit blit.

entries.meaning: (computing) A logical operation in which a block of data is rapidly moved or copied in memory, most commonly used to animate two-dimensional graphics.

verbs.description: blit (third-person singular simple present blits, present participle blitting, simple past and past participle blitted)

entries.meaning: (computing, transitive) To transfer by a blit operation.
